definition: lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: Both documents challenge the notion of a dog-eat-dog society, where survival of the fittest reigns.
sentences.chinese: 兩份文書都對適者生存的弱肉強食社會觀念提出挑戰。

sentences.english: Sam's interest tends towards the reputedly 'ugly' and predatory side of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 山姆鍾情于海洋所謂“醜陋”和弱肉強食的一面。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
